title: The Web is not inevitable
description: The Web needs you and me.
html:
We do not have the Web we have today by chance. It was not inevitable. The Web of tomorrow is likewise not inevitable.

There’s no guarantee the Web has a future.

There’s no guarantee the Web will be accessible.

There’s no guarantee the Web will remain significant.

There’s no guarantee the Web will continue to be for everyone.

Sometimes when we feel particularly insignificant we can shrink back into a belief that things will just take care of themself — or sometimes we shrink back into despair that things will not change.

Neither of these are true. Things will not take care of themself and things can change.

The Web we have was not born out of neglect. It has taken intentionality to become what it is. The Web we have today will not continue to be what it is and what we envision it to become if we do not involve ourselves.

Yes, it’s good to take a break when your burnt out and tired. Yes, it’s good to know when to stop or circle back when something isn’t working. Yes, it’s good to humbly trust others. These are all healthy, necessary things to do if we want to see the Web thrive, but do not remain extinguished, stalled, or sidelined.

The Web needs you and me.
